qas.question: What group advocates leveling the playing field?
How does the International Solar Energy Society propse to level the playing field?

answers.text: by redressing the continuing inequities in public subsidies of energy technologies and R&D

qas.question: What is the key to stabilizing the earth's climate?
What group rejects leveling the playing field?

plausible_answers.text: redressing the continuing inequities in public subsidies of energy technologies and R&D

qas.question: How does the International Solar Energy Society propose to not level the playing field?
What is the key to not stabilizing the earth's climate?

context: Lester Brown has argued that "a world facing the prospect of economically disruptive climate change can no longer justify subsidies to expand the burning of coal and oil. Shifting these subsidies to the <a2_0><b5_0>development of climate-benign energy sources<b5_0/><a2_0/> such as wind, solar, biomass, and geothermal power is the key to stabilizing the earth's climate." The <a0_0><b3_0>International Solar Energy<b3_0/> Society<a0_0/> advocates "leveling the playing field" <a1_0>by <b4_0>redressing the continuing inequities in public subsidies of energy technologies and R&D<b4_0/><a1_0/>, in which the fossil fuel and nuclear power receive the largest share of financial support.
